intro: Gymnanthes brasiliensis f. rufescens, commonly known as the red-stemmed sycamore, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive red-brown stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically hidden within cupules. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
